events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th and filed the claim for the damages sustained.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial accident report indicating a car-to-car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the customer's claim and coordinate the following steps for assessment.
The claim acknowledgment notice was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and outlining the next procedures in handling the accident claim.
Additional documents were requested from the customer, including photographs of the vehicle damage and the official police report of the accident.
The customer submitted all required documents promptly, including detailed photos and the accident report, to support the claim evaluation.
An internal investigation was initiated to assess the extent of vehicle damages and verify the circumstances of the collision.
The investigation report was finalized, confirming the validity of the claim and documenting all damages incurred during the accident.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on repair estimates and coverage terms defined in the policy.
The customer provided positive feedback regarding the handling and communication throughout the claim process.
Approval was granted for the claim following the customer's acceptance of the settlement and verification of all required conditions.
The settlement payment was issued to the customer's designated account to cover the costs of vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed after payment disbursement, with all outstanding issues resolved to the customer's satisfaction.
All claim records and related documents were archived in the system for future reference and auditing purposes.
